formattedAddress: 308 E 6th St, New York, NY 10003, USA
adrFormatAddress: 308 E 6th St, New York, NY 10003, USA

editorialSummary.text: Inspired by Tim Burton's movies, this whimsical, goth hangout serves American fare & cocktails.

originalText.text: Spooky songs and food = Such a vibe!! The decor, the performances, the staff and the food made this such an enjoyable experience. You do need to make a reservation on Yelp, and it is a Fixed priced menu with amazing options and plenty of Vegan/Vegetarian options. The staff were absolutely amazing and friendly and the performers made sure to give each table that special love and attention. While it may seem a little pricey the quality of the food is worth it and this helps keep the performances alive. If you are looking for a cool outing with friends or a different vibe for a date, Beetle House is for you. They even sell some of the oddities and decor in the back room.

originalText.text:
Really cool place. The decorations and atmosphere are spectacular.
You're not going to be saying how great your server was upon leaving. Our server was talking care of what looked like 8 or more tables in a small, crowded room. So, she was busy. We all walked in at the same time,  at opening, at 4pm. so I got the lack of attention.
You're not coming here for the food. However, it was really good. Each plate has its own name and special features. It was a little dark, which makes it hard to really appreciate the artwork and creativity that goes into each plate. But you will get the picture. The drinks before dinner had their own flare and appealing look and taste.
You will be talking about your experience with the show while you're dining. Interactive show, taking pictures, and talking to the cast was what we enjoyed.
Just walk around and enjoy the atmosphere and artwork on the walls and in the bar area. Have fun. That is what this place is about...     Halloween is every day here !!!

originalText.text: This place was awesome. First thing was service; we were a group of six that had to do three separate reservations, but were able to all be seated together. The food was delicious and the 3 course meal was justily priced. The characters however were what truly made the place. The audience participation helped make things stand out. If you ever get a chance to visit do it, you won't be disappointed.

originalText.text: One of my favorite restaurants in NYC!!! I’m obsessed with Tim Burton and this place is just so inspiring and cool! From the decor to the food to the drinks! Everything is amazing! It is a prefix price so just be ready for that! It’s worth it and their new location is much more spacious! I love it. Thanks for a great celebration!

text.text: One of my favorite restaurants in NYC!!! I’m obsessed with Tim Burton and this place is just so inspiring and cool! From the decor to the food to the drinks! Everything is amazing! It is a prefix price so just be ready for that! It’s worth it and their new location is much more spacious! I love it. Thanks for a great celebration!

originalText.text: This was an unforgettable experience. My teen and tween loved it as did I. It's a small place, so def make a reservation. It is themed around Beetlejuice, Addams Family, Nightmare Before Christmas and other equally macabre classics. The decor was awesome. The food is also horrors themed, but not corny, scary or gross. It was also some of the best we had in NYC. (The one reviewer must have been having a bad day!) It is a set price of $60 for app, main course, and dessert which found reasonable since there are also periodic performances. We saw Beetlejuice, Wednesday Addams, and Elvira, they even come by to talk with you and have pictures. Although they have a menu for smaller kids, this is a PG13 type situation. A really good time and perfect way to wrap up our trip.
